title: I'm A Celebrity 2019 line-up: Harry Redknapp lets slip Ian Wright paid £1m
text:
Harry Redknapp revealed that Ian Wright was being paid £1m to go on I’m A Celeb

Former King of the Jungle Harry Redknapp has claimed Ian Wright will be in this year’s I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here – and he’s being paid £1 million.

The footballing legend, who appeared on the ITV show in 2018, accidentally let slip the secret during one of his guest appearances in Nottingham.

The star, who is currently touring the country with his show ‘An Evening With Harry Redknapp’ appeared at the Royal Concert Hall in Nottingham on Monday night.

Fan Luke Pawley, who attended the event took to Twitter shortly after his appearance to reveal Harry’s slip-up.

He tweeted: ‘Just got home from seeing @Redknapp in Nottingham. Interestingly, he let slip that Ian Wright has been paid £1m to appear on this year’s #ImACeleb.’

One of Harry Redknapp’s fans took to Twitter to reveal the slip-up (Picture: @LMPawley)

Luke later told Metro.co.uk how Harry revealed the news.

He said: ‘He was asked why he went in the jungle and said, “Well they paid me half a million quid, so that helped. Ian Wright’s going in this year and they’re paying him a million”.’

And while the full line-up hasn’t been confirmed just yet, there has been lots of speculation surrounding who could be entering the Australian jungle.

Harry accidentally revealed the news at one of his guest appearances (Picture: Rex Features)

The latest star to be rumoured for the show is singer Nadine Coyle.

The former Girls Aloud star is the latest celebrity hotly tipped to be headed into camp and show bosses are allegedly thrilled to have her on board – hoping she’ll spill all on her old bandmates, including Cheryl and Kimberley Walsh.

According to The Sun, Nadine, who recently split from her long-term partner and baby daddy Jason Bell, is hoping that a stint in the jungle will help to kickstart her career again.

The Girls Aloud singer is the latest star rumoured to go in the jungle (Photo by C Brandon/Redferns)

A source claimed: ‘Nadine is a big name and ITV was keen to get her. It’s no secret there’s no love lost between [Nadine and Cheryl] and Nadine is refreshingly honest about what went on [in Girls Aloud] from her perspective.

‘I’m A Celebrity could well be the start of something big for her again.’

ITV have been approached for a comment.

I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out of Here! returns to ITV this November.
